content.detailedDescription:
I went out to my back yard to smoke and i looked up at the sky which was overcast from the rain today, and below the cloud cover moving due south was an object that appeared to me to look like a one inch horizontal line with cream colored lights blinking from left to right.  it was like they were blinking like this:

* then
** then
***
*****
******
and then blank, and it would start back at one light again.  i've never seen anything similar to this, it made no sound and moved slowly; not what i'd expect from a ufo.

could you please confirm this sighting or tell me that you received no other reports, just let me know either way.
content.summary: I went out to my back yard to smoke and i looked up at the sky which was overcast from the rain today, and below the cloud cover moving due south was an object that appeared to me to look like a one inch horizontal line with cream colored lights blinking

content.detailedDescription:
I was at work at aproximately 9:00 to 9:15 p.M. talking on my cell phone when a big bright green meteor fell from east to west direction directly overhead of me. it lasted in the sky for about 4 seconds much longer than meteors should last. this is not the first time i have seen this - about 6 or 7 years ago i saw the exact same big green meteor event as i described above except this one went from a west to east direction. the one i saw years before occurred at 92nd and federal blvd and also was very slow moving. these 2 diffrent events were almost identically exact in what i saw except the directions of movement and the strange part about them both was that to me they seemed to be moving on exact east to west and west to east latitudes. the one 6 or 7 years ago went in an exact paralell to 92nd ave at federal and the one i saw the other night seemed to be exactly paralell to the nearby streets of 48th ave and 52nd aves as well. i see others saw this event so it would be nice to see if they witnessed the same patterns i did. 

 oh and also when the meteor went overhead my cell phone dropped the call i was on.
content.summary: Very slow big bright green meteor

content.detailedDescription: I was living in kagel canyon and i was driving up the canyon road alone on my way home. it was mid afternnon and no one elso around. i noticed a shiney sphere about 6 inches in diameter floating slowly down the road in the distance. i thought it might be some sort of remote control toy. i stopped the car and sat staring at this silvery irridesent ball coming towards me.  it stopped right in front of my windshield as if checking me out also.  after about 10 seconds it floated over my car and continued down the canyon road. i never felt in danger or threatened.  i told a few people, but was just laughed at so i never spoke of it again.  i was wondering if anyone else has had this same experience?
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: I came face to face with a floating sphere

content.detailedDescription:
I was seated in the back row on the right side of the aircraft at the window. the movie had just ended and i opened my window blind. i then observed a cylinder-shaped object pass under the plane at approx. 150-200 feet. the object flew under the plane from left to right at a 45 degree angle to the plane. it then made an abrupt slight left turn and flew perpindicular away from the plane but horizontal to the ground until out of my view. 

the object had a skin that reminded me of the skin of an f 104 from my air force days. it was metalic and very shiney. i also did not see any thing that looked like windows on it. it was also very fast.

the plane i was on was coming from atlanta going to ontario, california and we were still about 1 1/2 hours from landing. i believe we were probably over new mexico or arizona.

i remember thinking afterward, "oh my god- they are real"!
content.summary: Cylinder shaped, 50-60 feet long, 10-15 feet wide, rounded nose and rear, black on rear, gray on nose

content.detailedDescription: Watching the stars on halloween night, it was cloudless around 8:20, i had just checked the time on my phone a few minutes earlier, i noticed four tightly packed diffusely lit round objects almost touching as if they were one object in a diamond shape craft travelling from the south to the north. it was about as high as the jets fly overhead, higher than the commercial jets that take off and land at mci. there were no normal lights that signify that it was a commercial flight. i lost sight of it very quickly as the city lights washed out the object. the object was bigger than a commercial jet and was travelling in a straight path faster than a commercial jet.
content.summary: Defuse object heading south to north

content.detailedDescription:
For what it's worth...

i was in castro valley, california, waiting for a stop light. i was looking east, and noticed a bright, metallic appearing object in the sky. i could see that it was bigger than a point, but i could not determine its shape. my first thought was that it must be a mylar balloon floating up from some birthday party, until i realized that it was not moving, and this was a very windy day. i kept staring at it, wishing i had a pair of binoculars or something, because i wanted to know the shape. then i noticed that the stop light changed, and i looked to the street, and started to cross. when i got near the curb on the opposite side, i looked up again, and it was gone. i would estimate that time i spent walking was no longer than 15 seconds. i sure wish i had my eyes on it when it disappeared. i would like to have seen it if it went away at a high speed or something like that. to this day, i wonder what it might have been. my best theory is that it might be an aircraft landing light pointed directly toward me, which was turned off while i was crossing the street. this was broad daylight, so i am not sure i would have seen an aircraft landing light at this apparent distance. if it was an airplane, it had to be very far away to appear to be hovering like that. this is an old story, and i just thought i would mention it in case it meant anything to anyone who might have been in that area at that time. i know it was no later than 1995, in the summer, and i am pretty sure it was in the afternoon, which means the sun was behind me. that might have been why i thought at first it was a mylar ballon. a mylar balloon would reflect a lot of sunlight under those conditions. balloons usually rotate and move around, but this light was very steady. the time of the entire event was about 2 minutes.
i had a friend in that area who says he saw 3 lights in a triangle formation flying very slowly over the rock quarry he was working at on the night shift. it followed the bottom of the valley where this quarry was located, and stayed at a very low altitude. i now think this description fits one of those big black triangles seen at night. i don't know when this was, or exactly where, but it was near castro valley. he was an old salt of the earth kind of guy who was not likely to make up stuff like that. he was near retirement at the time i knew him. i am sure his sighting happened a few years before the thing i saw there.
the county is just a guess. i am not sure which county castro valley is in, but it's in the bay area, near san leandro and oakland.
content.summary: Bright metallic object in sky

content.detailedDescription:
I was standing on my front porch, i had just lit a cigar and neighborhood kids were trick or treating. as i turned around toward the street my eye caught a red light in the sky at about 2 o'clock high. this red light was approaching slowly toward me. at first i thought it was a plane however it was moving too slow to be a plane.

i stepped off the porch to observe the light as it was passing over my house. it passed straight over my house at a height of i would guess to be several thousand feet. looking at the object straight above it had no flashing marker lights as a plane would have. the object appeared to be round and it glowed orange/red. as it passed over the brighness of the object suddenly changed to a faint red dot. i could track this dot as it proceeded north east. i lost it as it passed behind the neighbors house. the object made no noise. 

i called my father at 6:58pm after the object left my field of view. he lives about 20 minutes in that direction and i asked if he would go out and look west. hoping he would see this object as it approached. my father noticed a white light moving slowly but didnt think anything more of it.

while on the phone with my father i looked up and another orb was moving on the same trajectory. i disconnected the call and managed to take one photo with my camera phone. the orb faded out as the first one did and i could track a smaller faint dot as it moved north east. second sighting was at 7:00 pm

shortly after two older teens were walking in front of the house. i asked them if they saw anything and the teens indicated that they saw what looked like a flying pumpkin.
content.summary: Two red glowing orbs slowly drift over my house south west to north east

content.detailedDescription:
At my house, about 5 miles from a town of about 20,000, you can see the lightning from thunderstorms in wichita,
kansas city, springfield,mo., and fayetteville ar. this is a lot of sky, and i have always loved  to sit
at night and just watch it. i grew up on a farm, and had always liked to stargaze. i was sitting
on our back porch about a year ago looking to the west southwest when three lights shaped
in an equilateral  triangle came across the sky. the tip of the triangle  acted like the front of 
a craft pointing the direction of travel, but i can not tell you it was a solid craft or three points of light. they looked to me like bright stars, but i have a color deficit at a distance, and probably
don't make a very good witness for you on that point. but i can tell you that it acted like  one  solid object, took  a minute or two to cross half of the sky, and then stopped. it did not slow down and stop, it just stopped. and then it rotated on its front tip, sat there for a second or two and then was 
gone. it was like the lights were turned off. i am very sorry i did not write down a date and time.
i am telling the story in hopes that someone else saw this. i could be off quite a little on 
the time, but it was dark outside, and if this was one object it was beyond huge. it was also very high in the sky, so someone else should have been able to see it. i know that what i saw was 
impossible, unless it had no mass, and that has bothered me all this time, that is why i am telling this now. i also know that it is hard to believe unless you are the person that sees it, and it changes
you when it happens to you.
content.summary: 3 points of light came from the southwest, high in the sky, and then stopped without slowing down. it then rotated and was gone.

content.detailedDescription:
Time approx: 8:30 pm edt 10/31/2008

i went to the store and from the store parking lot noticed what at first glance appeared to be a flare. i live north of a military base so it would be normal. i watched it for a good minute and realized it was in the wrong area to be from the base. it also did not drop in altitude or flicker in any form. 

i proceeded to drive home. on the drive i kept an eye on it. it appeared to just sit there at about 300 500 feet, but it is hard to tell while driving. once on jones rd., i continued through the first curve, heading for the 90 degree right ahead. while in the first curve i had to dim my lights for an oncoming car. i was almost to the right turn and still watching the ufo, i switched on my high beams again. at that moment the ufo dropped in altitude and proceeded to move quickly to the right through the trees. i made the turn and watched through the trees as the ufo disappeared from sight.

after arriving home i stood outside for about 10 minutes looking all around. i haven't at this time 10:12 pm 10/31/2008 viewed it again. this is my second time in 25 years viewing a ufo. the other in 1983 was in the same county and did about the same thing.
content.summary: Thats not a flare

content.detailedDescription: I was coming back home from a late night run to the grocery store and saw a weird object in the sky in front of my house. it was a triangular shaped object (i didn't see an actual triangle, but i saw three lights that made me think it must have been a triangle) the lights were blue red and green. it wasn't moving like a plane or a helicopter but sideways. i lost sight of it behind a building.
content.summary: Tri-colored light

content.detailedDescription: I was sitting outside facing east. two small round objects appeared flying east to west, one above and ahead of the other. positioned approximately midway between jensen beach and stuart florida.They were low flying about the same as a small news helicopter. i stood up watching wondering why there was no sound. the lower one descended out of site and the upper one flew west out of site. they were flying about the speed as a normal helicopter. 12 to 14 seconds duration. nothing i have ever witnessed. the lack of noise is disturbing.
content.summary: Two white/yellow spheres flew low, 800'-1000', east to west. no noise. lower one dropped out of sight toward the ground.

content.detailedDescription: Was outside and looking up at the stars i noticed something that looked like a star was actually moving from north/east to south/west. there were no blinking lights that i could see, and the object was going in a straight line but kind of slithering in a right left motion. about 10 to 15 seconds after the object moved overhead, i saw a burst of light that went from west to east (the objest going north to south)that burst lasted about 3 seconds. i followed the object as far as i could see it then it faded out of sight. it did not go out of sight like a plane would, it just seemed to fade. the sky was very clear and i could see the big and litter dipper's. i have reported to you several times about seeing objects, but i still get kind of excited when i see a new one.
content.summary: Witnessed an object crossing the night sky

content.detailedDescription:
Time:  appx. 1:40 - 1:47 pm, arizona time (no dst), friday, oct. 31, 2008

weather:  warm, mostly sunny, clouds on the horizons, bulk of middle sky clear.

eye witness location: west sedona, az., near the safeway grocery.

ufo location:  

starting point: flying, north of west sedona, perhaps slightly northwest.

altitude:  layman's guess, at least 1000 feet, but perhaps a few miles or more depending on actual size of craft.

direction of travel:  appx. east/northeast at first, and then began to move to the north.  towards the end, it appeared to come back south a bit.

speed: very, very slow.  even the local tourist bi-planes fly faster.  this could be equated to a bi-plane seen way, way off in the distance.

at approximately 1:40 pm, i looked up from where i was sitting outside, to see a black hawk  of some kind, flying maybe 50 feet up.  as i admired the bird, and followed its' flight, it led me to this unknown object in the sky.

my first inclination was that it was a large piece of paper trash, such as a sheet of newspaper, that had been kicked up by the winds, as does happen sometimes.

it did not, and never did at any point appear to be like any kind of plane i have ever seen, although i kept a close eye on it, trying to look for signs that it might be a plane.

the physical size was perhaps that of a medium altitude jet.  for comparison, the highest flying jets appear to me to be pinpoints of light in the sky, while with the low flying ones you are able to make out wings, tail, engines, ect.  this was too small to make out details, but significantly bigger than the 'pinpoints of light'.

the reason why i thought it was a piece of trash at first, was because of its' erratic pulsating light that it emitted or reflected.  it was immediately apparent that this was not a plane,  helicopter, balloon, or any other kind of man-made flying object.  it immediately reminded me of the thousand other times in my life where i've seen newspapers and other trash blown high up by the wind.

i at first assumed that the sun light was simply reflecting off of this piece of trash, and because the object was being 'blown around', and possibly changing shape, as a sheet of newspaper would, it would explain the erratic pulses of light coming from it.

however, as i continued to watch, my curiosity grew, as this began behaving less like a piece of trash, and more like a controlled object.

its' flight path was stable, moving laterally across my vision, and its' speed and altitude  appeared steady.  the flight path of blown trash is usually very erratic, while this object sustained its first path for at least 3-5 minutes, before switching to the northerly path.

at this point, i began to quickly rule out the 'trash' theory, and moved on to the 'large white bird' theory.   a large white bird, with shifting wing angles, might explain the pulsating light, and the very slow speed.  but are there any large, white birds in arizona?  at the time of writing this, i do not know, but i've certainly never seen any before now.

there are plenty of the black 'hawks' that fly around, like the one that led me to this ufo.  and as this ufo was fairly high up, it would have to at least be the size of one of these hawks.

this black hawk that led me to the ufo, seemed to lead me to two other comparisons, almost as if it was trying to help me make this report!

the next time i saw the hawk, it was probably 1000 feet up, or more, and it allowed me to compare the sizes between them.

the 3rd time, the hawk seemed to point out two other jets beginning to come across the sky.  the first things i noticed were the contrails.  i saw about 6 different jets around different parts of the sky over the next couple of minutes, and they all had contrails.  the ufo did not have any form of contrail.

now i will try to describe the pulsating light coming from the ufo.  it did not appear to have a regular pattern to the pulse, however it could have, but i would have needed a video camera to determine that.

the pulsating light would actually completely extinguish regularly, so that the object could no longer be seen at all.  this pulsing light was the only thing making the object visible for me.  now, this was in bright sunlight, so the object may not have been actually disappearing, just invisible to my eye when the reflectivity was low.

the pulsing of the light would 'switch on' in two different ways:  1) quickly, like a flash, and 2) more slowly, kind of fading in, like a dimmer switch.

the light would remain on, for perhaps a half of a second, and then fade or flash back out, and out of my vision.  the light never remained off for more than about half a second either.  the pulsing was continuous.  in fact, it quickly reminded me of the navy movies i've watched where morse code is flashed by submarine towers at night and in the fog.

as the object began to move north, it seemed to get a little bit smaller, as one would expect.  but then it did appear to come back towards me for a bit at the end.

after i had watched it for appx. 7 minutes, i decided to run and get my video camera.  when i came back out, however, i searched for 10 minutes and was unable to locate it.

this is probably the first bona fide ufo i've ever seen, and nothing else that i have ever seen, or heard described as normal by aviators fits what i saw today.
content.summary: Irregular pulsating light, slow moving

content.detailedDescription: My husband and i have wondered for years if someone else may have witnessed this same huge orange pulsating sphere. it was the friday before easter 1968. we were traveling to nm to visit relatives. we left ogden after work on friday. we traveled in the evening because traveling with 2 little babies was easier at night. we were traveling south and were approx. 20-30 miles past moab heading to monticello. we were the only car on that stretch of highway in the church rock / looking glass rock area of the desert. it was dark with no other lights in sight except our headlights. i'm estimating it was about 11:00 pm when all of a sudden the whole surrounding area of the desert lit up like daylight. i don't know where it came from but we could see through our windsheild a huge orange pulsating light hovering right above us. it was about 30 ft. in diameter and approx. 20-40 feet above us. i remember telling my husband,"stop, it's going to hit us". he braked and we just stared at it for what seemed like an eternity but it was probably only a minute or two. we did not hear anything or see it coming at us, all of a sudden this huge ball just appeared above our car. after a minute or so the light/sphere just sort of bounced over a couple of times to the east and disappeared over a mountain. the only comparison of what we saw that night would be like a bright orange sunset in the dimensions i described. i remember we were very scared and drove to monticello, the nearest town and parked in front of a downtown business and waited for dawn to continue our trip. we were just a young married couple with two little babies and it never occured to us to stop and report what we saw. we have always wondered if anyone else saw this. after this my husband and i became very interested in ufo's and to this day i wish i had documented every detail and the exact time everything happened. my husband disagrees with the time of sighting and thinks we lost some time that night. a few years back i wrote down everything my husband and i remembered from that night. this is the best recollection of this event to my knowledge.
content.summary: In the spring of 1968, in the middle of the desert  at night, past moab, a huge orange pulsating sphere appeared above our car

content.detailedDescription: I awoke sometime after 1am, because i could not sleep. so i went out back to have a smoke. the night seemed pretty calm, until i saw a flash of light right there on the grass in front of me. at first i thought it was a lightning strike. that was until i saw what came out of it. it was somekind of transparent being. i froze solid in my chair,didnt move,or yell for anybody. i just looked at it, as it approched me. for some reason i wasnt affraid, when i should have been. it showed itself to be one of those grey beings, except it was a little taller than me,and i'm 5'8''.I could understand it clearly as if i was talking to anybody else. it said " do not be affraid, for you are the one we seek". he said they will soon come to take me back home. it touched my hand, and my hand began to light up, i could see my bones in my hand, so i pulled away. then i became a little affraid. it said my mother has sent for me. it said they are all around me and that the time is soon near to reveal they have been gaurdians. and just like it appeared, it dissappeared, in a flash. this is not the first contact with this being. the first time i seen it, i was 10 yrs old, and we lived in the country. at that time i couldn't beleive i had seen what i was looking at, so i dismissed it as an illusion. i dont know whats about to happen to our planet, but its something very big.
content.summary: I just looked at it, as it approched me

content.detailedDescription: Unidentified lights captured on motion activated still camera
content.summary: Unidentified lights captured on motion activated still camera

content.detailedDescription: My wife and i were enjoying a glass of wine by the outdoor fireplace at approximately 22:15 on a cool clear fall evening. we live north of dallas in mckinney texas, with an unobstructed view to the south. i have grown up around aircraft and i am very knowledgeable about most types of air planes. our house seems to be located in a position that gets a large amount of care-flight helicopters either directly over, or very near our location. we were watching the air traffic coming and going out of love field, dfw and addison airport, always trying to figure out who was going where. we noticed what we assumed to be a care-flight or a private plane headed directly towards us from love field (due south). it was a bright red/orange light that resembled a bright landing light or a spot light on the front of a helicopter that was pointed towards us from a distance of approximately 10 ��� 15 miles and at a low altitude of 500 ��� 1500 agl (above ground level). after several minutes, we noticed that the aircraft never seemed to get any closer. at that time i got my binoculars out to get a better look at what was going on. the only thing that i could tell was that the red/orange light was all that i could see. i thought i should have been able to see a rotating beacon and anti-collision lights. after a total of approximately 5 - 6 minutes, the light moved due west. now that i had what should be a side view of the craft, i knew that i could see the rotating beacon and the anti-collision lights. not only were there no other lights, the spotlight seemed to still be pointed to the north. this is when we both knew we were seeing something that just wasn���t quite right. it was moving to the west at about the speed a fast moving helicopter would be going at a distance of about 5- 10 miles. after a few more minutes, it stopped again. trying to rationalize what we were seeing, i thought a larger aircraft descending out of the south towards love field and then turning towards dfw (this may be possible due to the runways at love are 33 ��� 13 and dfw are 36 ��� 18), but we still couldn���t figure out why the light was that bright and moving that slow. the light was now standing still over dfw for another 4 ��� 5 minutes. as we were both watching this thing, it went due south over the horizon in a fraction of a second. after we could see the light move over the horizon, i had the feeling that the light was much larger and higher than what we had first assumed. i now believe it was approximately 5,000 agl, assuming that it was indeed over love field and dfw. the size of the light was approximately the size of a bb at arm���s length. the next morning we anxiously watched the news for a story on this light over dallas, there was no mention of anything. i called the towers at love field, dfw and approach control via land line and no one knew anything about what we had witnessed the night before.
content.summary: From stationary to slow moving to stationary to thousand of mph over the horizon.

content.detailedDescription: Went to a friends ranch in george west texas october 14, 2008 we were there to move some deer blinds and mow the fields. prior to that my friend showed me some photos taken with a game camera of what appeared to be 4-6 aliens that were transparent almost like a ghost but we could make out the head and eyes. my friends and i looked over the photos and believed this to be nothing more that dust particles. later on that night of october 14, 2006 i was at our campsite around 11:05pm and had an uneasy feeling that whole day like we were being watched. i was making my way around our trailer to put up some gear when i saw something moving from out of the brush. i stayed still acting like i did not notice anything when i saw a skinny arm and leg come out of the brush and change color to match the surrounding bushes. i immediately turned around and stomped my foot on the ground and clapped my hands together very loud and screamed get out. to my surprise whatever this was let out a loud scream and took off running through the bushes. my friends jumped out of their seats and said what was that? i replied have no idea that was the last time i have been to the ranch in george west.
content.summary: Alien contact

content.detailedDescription: Looked out my back window, i saw a red moving disc ,with white and silver rotating. it went behind trees and i lost it. this also happened on the 29th. i was unable to sleep on both nights. everyone in the house was asleep, except my cats. it moved from west to east, near pleasantdale rd.
content.summary: Saw a red,with silver white moving at a moderate speed.

content.detailedDescription: Bicycling through the county fairgrounds looked up at the huge us flag and saw two objects in tandem moving west.  this from the general direction of the airport and with their aspect reckoned they were national guard jets.  did not think about it until they manueved to the south, then back west, no sound.  watched about thirty seconds with my friend and then they were gone.  no flapping wings, hard to tell how high but looked like about 3k feet up.
content.summary: Flying in tandem, silvery orbs, disappeared suddenly

content.detailedDescription:
It was a low overcast morning; cool and expecting rain.  i was heading for work and was only a half mile from my home going south on north 67th street.  as i am driving up a hill on north 67th street 2 small discs passed over me heading east (there are open fields on each side of this street).   they were traveling at a slow rate of speed and were just above the trees.   as they passed over me, very quiet and one leading while the other was a little to the right and a little back, i stopped the car and watched them go by. i was surprised and knew these were not known human aircraft (they were so quiet.).  

what i saw was 2 silver discs with glass domes.   i could see the passenger in each one.  these crafts seemed to be made for only one passenger each, they were that small.  i'd say about the size of my car.   one passenger was looking at the other.   i did not see any helmets and could not see whether they were human or not.   all i know is that they were traveling east very slow and very quietly.

there was no way for me to follow them.  i had to go to work.  the thought that came to my mind after they left my sight is that they were heading for the richard gabour air force base, which was still being used then. and i knew what i saw was not human built (as far as i knew).

sorry no photos--wasn't expecting to see this.
content.summary: Two small discs pass over me heading east.   i could see one being in each craft.

content.detailedDescription: Taking pictures of the fall folage  on 23 north  in to huntsville arkansas . was about 2:30 in the afternoon on the 19th of oct.  i did not see this  until i downloaded them on my computer . it may not be nothing  but i will post it anyhow.
content.summary: Not sure

content.detailedDescription:
Looked out my back window, i saw a red moving disc ,with white and silver rotating. it went behind trees and i lost it. this also happened on the 29th. i was unable to sleep on both nights. everyone in the house was aslee
p, except my cats. it moved from west to east, near pleasantdale rd.I always know when they appear. it was not a plane, there was no sound.
content.summary: Saw a red,with silver white moving at a moderate speed.

content.detailedDescription:
I had just gotten out of my car and walked over to my mailbox to get the mail.  before i could even reach for the mail inside, i saw what looked like a fireball of red light.  it turned yellow and zipped a short distance before becoming an orb of green light.  it stayed there for about 2 seconds before disappearing in a flash of green light.

i just stood there stunned with my hand in the mailbox for a couple of seconds before coming back to my senses.  i didn't know what to do, feel, or think.  i must have gotten the mail out already because i had it in my arms and then i thought "i saw a ufo."  i felt dizzy walking back up to my door as well.  it might've just been me though.

the thing about that light was it all had to have been within earth's atmosphere.  it was just too big to be a far off shooting star and it was too small to be a low flying airplane.  (i live farly close to a small town airport.)  i don't know of anything on earth that could've produced something like that.  also, it looked like something straight out of star wars or something.  as if a ship were zipping into hyperspace from earth's atmosphere.  

i never used to believe in ufo's before, but i know what i saw.
i've told just a few other people including my parents, and they all didn't believe me, saying "uhuh...Suuurrree."
content.summary: There was a fireball of red light, which turned to yellow, then it turned into a small sphere of green light for about  2 seconds before disappearing.

content.detailedDescription: I live in downtown manchester, but the night sky is still pretty easy to see. i live across from a parking garage, so i figured i'd go up to the roof and see if i could see anything. i live maybe 5 miles from a major airport, so lights at night are nothing out of the ordinary because i can usually tell by listening for engine noise and lights. as i was walking to the parking garage and looking down the street between the parking garage and my building, two close together yellowish lights passed across the sky and behind a high-rise from (my) right to left, maybe between 500-700 ft in the air. it seemed odd because aircraft usually have a flashing light, and the two lights seemed too close together since the plane would have been passing by perpendicular to my field of vision. at first i assumed it was a 747, but as i was climbing the steps in the garage i realized i didn't hear any jet or prop noise. i settled in on the roof of the parking garage. after 5 minutes of scanning the sky i focused on a twinkling red light approximately northwest in the sky. whenever i see something at night i have a sort of mental checklist, is it 1. a planet, 2. a satellite, 3. plane, 4. helicopter. the more i focused on it, i could tell that it was moving. not slowly, but in rapid jerky movements in random directions, far too fast to be any sort of conventional aircraft. it's possible that my vision could be somewhat shaky because i wear glasses, but as it was close by to other stars, i am quite sure that this was neither a star nor a planet, and my vision wasn't playing tricks on me. after 15 minutes it appeared to be closer, and i could almost make out other lights as if it were a triangle or tetrahedron that were tumbling around as it moved, but i'm not entirely confident on that. i remember looking away for a quick second and saw another set of lights, one white and one yellowish on the horizon due west of me. again, at first they seemed stationary and i didn't hear any jet noise so i continued to watch them for a few minutes, and they were slowly moving back and forth in unison, approx. 4-5 seconds at a time before stopping and moving in the other direction. i could have stayed out longer, but i was cold and tired, so i gave up and went back inside, satisfied that i at least saw something i couldn't readily explain.
content.summary: One low flying set of lights, followed by two sets of  moving red/orange/white lights

content.detailedDescription:
Between 7:30 pm & 9:20 pm i saw six different occurences from white moving lights in pairs or flashing up to three & four. speeds were easily 3x commercial aircraft. also an orange flashing with mixed colors as referred to by someone else who also saw it in case 13423. i also got it making a quick altitude adjustment.

i have multiple photos, 10-15 sec. exposures off a tripod (nikon d3 camera using a 200 mm lens), of all these. all taken last night from my place on the edge of hico by stephenville. contact me. if you have investigators in the area they need to come see me.
content.summary: Numerous photos of rapid moving intermittent light, white & orange.

content.detailedDescription: I was driving north-east on hwy. 515 and i pulled off the road to check a load on my truck. got back into my truck and pulled up to a stop sign and heard a low ocillating sound that i thought was from my truck but it was not the same sound pitch. thats when i look up out of my windshield and saw an object moving over and perpendicular to hwy 515 going south approx. 300 to 400 feet above the ground. object was triangular in shape and the leading two points had faint low lights on each two points. the single rear point had two lights together. one was reddish and the other was a white light. i cannot remember if the rear lights were blinking or not. each leg of the triangle was about 200 to 300 feet apart. i saw the rear lights first then a second later i saw the faint front lights. i'm not certain that the lights were connected but it seemed to be so because the background of the sky was lighter than the foreground of the craft. i thought maybe this was a helicopter but i only heard a faint sound of a low pitch ocillating sound. i thought maybe the front lights were from the rear double lights and that it was a reflection off mist in the sky but it was a clear night. the object moved slowly about 40 to 50 mph. i first thought that this was one of the silent military helicopters but realized that there are no bases close by. as i drove onto the main road i lost sight of the object. the location was about 5 miles on the north side of blue ridge, georgia going north toward blairsville, georgia.
content.summary: 300 to 400 feet above ground with low white lights on two points and one red/white light on third point.

content.detailedDescription:
Between 1 pm and 2 pm, witness was outside her home with her elderly mother, her niece and grandchild, after returning from taking her mother around the corner for a walk.  mother was wheelchair bound and the day was so beautiful that witness said she was enjoying the warm winter day with her family members.

witness was looking for birds to show her grandchild who liked the activity.  the trees were bare of leaves and there were no birds in sight.  the sky was clear blue and sunny.  as witness was searching the sky, she noticed an object in the sky that looked at first like a tool or an upside down screw.  she thought to herself .. "what the hell is that?" and asked her niece if she saw it.  she said her niece got frightened, said she didn't see anything and went in the house. 

witness continued to watch the object.  there was no noise, no sound, and the object was getting closer to her, very, very slowly.  as it came closer she saw that the object looked like a short lighthouse, wider at the bottom and smaller at the top.  it was just slowly flying in the sky at what witness estimated to be maybe 5 mph.  she described the object as being old and rusty looking, reminding her of something midieval, with no windows or doors visible.  as it approached closer to her view -- which she states "i never turned away, kept looking at it the whole time", it dropped closer to earth.

at this point, witness said she saw a metallic flash, like the way a pie pan would flash in the sun, and the object turned brilliant like glowing metal.  it began to change shape as she watched. first, it looked like a dumb bell and continued to glow. it then changed into an hourglass shape.  she noticed that seagulls began to fly around it attracted, she said, by the glint of the shiny metallic shape.  witness said that the seagulls began to glow as well. then, the object turned into a box shape, changing into the same color as the seagulls, like it was trying to camouflage itself. then it went back to the hour-glass shape, and began to move west in the direction of port st. joe.
content.summary: Short, lighthouse shaped ship morphed into hourglass shape

content.detailedDescription: This event is so old and i was quite young, i hesitate to even report it. i'm sorry in advance if this wastes anyone's time. --- it was two days before my brothers 10th birthday. my parents had taken him to el paso to shop for gifts. i stayed with my grandparents. i was 12. my grandma was sick so i spent a lot of time outside. i rode my bike everywhere. on this particular day i had eaten breakfast and headed out on my bike to "explore", my favorite pastime. i headed up to the foothills to follow gullies and rabbit trails, look for coyote tracks, whatever. i had been out awhile. i remember thinking i was getting hungry and it was getting late in the morning. i should get home for lunch. my intention was to go back down the wash, the way i had come, but decided to climb the bank and see if there might be a shorter route. i climbed to the top of the bank and that's when i saw it. it rose from behind the hill to my right. i would guess i was about a quarter mile from the hill. i remember thinking initially it was a giant balloon, it rose slowly like a balloon would, but it was the oscillation that bewildered me. it moved like a decelerating quarter that had been spun on a table, as the quarter slows it does that weird warped wobble, that was the movement this thing exhibited. it was a good size, it was disc shaped, no humps no bumps, nothing, it was non-descript and brown like paper bag or cardboard box brown. it rose, stayed stationary for a bit. it moved left about 3 lengths, then back right, then straight up. i watched it until it disappeared. as it  headed up, it rose slowly at first and then got faster. i have no idea how long i watched it. i put down 5 min but it could have been a couple minutes either way. i got a little scared, climbed back down and got home fast. my father was working at holoman afb on the high speed test track. he had taken me to several air shows and we spent a lot of time looking at planes and stuff. i told him about it later and he said it was probably nothing, so i just kind of blew it off. i always wondered what it was. i've never seen anything like it since. i hesitate to even report this. it seems so silly but maybe someone else has seen this thing. who knows, maybe my encounter will add credence to another���s.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Generic light brown oscillating disc.  rose, hovered ,moved twice then disappeared straight up.

content.detailedDescription:
I live on the southeast side of indianapolis, near beech grove.  i was coming home from a buddy's house a little after 1am.  i pulled in my subdivision, and when i was turning onto my street, i saw two bright white/orange lights off to the northwest.  i stopped my car at the intersection, and watched the lights for 2-3 minutes.  they were moving very slowly, but surely were headed right towards me.  while they were still 2-3 miles away, i quickly pulled in my driveway and got out to have a wider view.  they were moving northwest to southeast, but when they were about a mile away, they turned straight south.  i kept my eyes on them, and they moved ever so slowly closer.  by the time they were as overhead from me as they could be, they could not have been more than a half mile away, maybe 2,000 feet in the air.  when the first one passed, i saw one large orange oval light on the bottom, 6 more round white lights in the middle, a smaller red light on each side, and three white lights on what appeared to be the tail "wing" of the craft.  it was emitting two orange contrails, about the length of the craft, that could not be missed, they were very luminescent.  after the first two crafts passed, i looked back to the north, and i saw another emerge above the trees, and as it passed, another one came into view.  all of them were following the exact same path, almost like planes in a flight pattern near an airport, and all of them looked identical.  the odd thing about this was i've never seen a plane with this many lights on the bottom, especially with an orange light, and i live a good 30 miles from ind airport.  none of these crafts made a sound as they passed overhead, which is also odd because of the close proximity of them, and the wind was blowing straight in my direction, which would've helped any sound emitted reach me.  if they were jets, they would have easily been heard.  the same goes for helicopters, small private planes, etc...  it made no sense to me what i was witnessing.  i saw no more of them coming after 15 minutes or so, so i proceeded to go inside.  i watched the last part of conan o'brien, and on my way to go to bed, i peered outside one more time.  strangely enough, i saw one more craft, identical to the first four.  it followed the exact same path also, and it was going quite a bit faster than the first four, almost as if it was trying to catch up to the others.
this was my first time seeing any kind of unidentifiable object in my life, and to see 5 of them in one night really overwhelmed me.  i couldn't sleep at all, the curiosity of what those crafts were was too much for me to control.  whatever i saw, it was not conventional whatsoever.  the sight of them has been burned in my mind conitinuously since the sighting.
content.summary: 5 triangular unidentifiable objects
